result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
with Exhibit #1 attached

2:02 PM (64-06) Defendant Kenneth W Chadwick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Kenneth W Chadwick.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Samuel Barrett, from Walworth Sheriff's Department.
Samuel Barrett duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann. Witness has identified the defendant in court on the video. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received.
2:05PM - Cross examination by Attorney Jochman
Argument by the State. Requesting probable cause to be found.
Defense requests dismissal.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 

State is requesting 30 days for Arraignment Hearing.

Adj. 2:14PM
Arraignment scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Def. Discovery Demand

records.addlTxt: Petition for Waiver of Fees and Costs Affidavit of Indigency

Defendant Kenneth W Chadwick in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Kenneth W Chadwick.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jochman is meeting with defendant after court. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Order for Representation - No Repayment at this Time
Proposed Order for Representation

Defendant Kenneth Chadwick appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk of Courts is still looking for representation for defendant from out of county. Set on next week to see progress of representation. Defendant requesting form CV410A. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth W Chadwick in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court appoints attorney, no repayment as he is State Public Defenders Office eligible. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant Kenneth W Chadwick in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane appeared specially. Defendant does qualify for SPD. SPD Still trying to apppoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed Bond Filed with Court
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH BRYAN TIDWELL, FREDERICK TAYLOR, THOMAS SCHULTZ, JOSHUA POTTER, CHRISTOPHER MCFADDEN, SEAN MASON, MICHELLE LYONS, JILLIAN LEIGHTON, AND KRYSTAL GEHRKE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth W Chadwick in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for bond purposes. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Multiple prior convictions in Arizona. Cash bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
